did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Rice University Vice President for Student Affairs records: Ronald Stebbings, 1969-1985
did.abstract: This collection contains papers from Ronald Stebbings, former Vice President of Student Affairs. It includes minutes of faculty meetings of the entire university, as well as faculty meetings of the Space Physics and Astronomy program. It also contains various papers relating to the athletic committee, the publications Faculty Club Forum, and On Campus, and the Honor System. Also contains a photo directory of of faculty, research associates, students, and staff, as well as various items relating to the Space Physics and Astronomy program.

bioghist.head: Biographical and Historical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. Ronald F. Stebbings received his Ph.D. in atomic physics from University College London, in 1956. After receiving his degree, he worked at the Atomic Physics Laboratory in San Diego, California from 1958 to 1965. He returned to University College London in 1965, serving as a reader in physics there until 1968.

In the Fall of 1968, Dr. Stebbings joined the Rice University faculty as a professor, and later chairman, of the university's Space Physics and Astronomy department. From 1977 until 1982, Dr. Stebbings served as the Master of the Mary Gibbs Jones College, living in the residential college's master's home on campus with his wife and children during that period.

In 1983, Dr. Stebbings became the dean of undergraduate affairs, and on July 1, 1984 he was appointed Rice University's first Vice President for Student Affairs, by then president Norman Hackerman, joining three other administrators as the senior-most officials under the president. This change in title also involved a broadening of his responsibilities, as he became responsible for supervising the admissions, registrar's placement, and financial aid offices. This shift in responsibilites was done as an attempt to streamline the university's administration.
Dr. Stebbings served as Vice President for Student Affairs for ten years, before stepping down in 1993. After stepping down, he continued to work in Rice's Space Physics and Astronomy Department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains papers from Ronald Stebbings, former Vice President of Student Affairs. It includes minutes of faculty meetings of the entire university (1969-1985), as well as faculty meetings of the Space Physics and Astronomy program (1971-1985). It also contains various papers relating to the athletic committee (1976-1983), and issues of "Faculty Club Forum," "On Campus," and the Honor System. Also contains a photo directory of of faculty, research associates, students, and staff, as well as various items relating to the Space Physics and Astronomy program.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to Woodson Research Center in August, 2010.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University Vice President for Student Affairs: Ronald Stebbings, UA 216, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this collection must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.
